condition: Imagine that you receive the following letter from your current electricity supplier. Dear customer, We are working in partnership with LocalEnergy, a new local electricity company. Customers of the combined-provider service will get most of their electricity from locally produced, renewable sources, such as solar and wind farms. If there is not enough local energy to cover your needs, we will act as a back-up, so that you will always have the power you need. Alternatively, you can switch back to our single-provider service. This means that all your energy will continue to be provided by us. The price of each service will be the same as your current tariff. If you would like to stay with the combined-provider service, you do not need to do anything. If you would rather change back to the single-provider service, you need to go to our website, log in to your account, and check a box indicating that you would like to switch. It will take a few days to switch. You can switch back at any time. What would you choose to do in this scenario? Customers of the combined-provider service will get most of their electricity from locally produced, renewable sources, such as solar and wind farms. If there is not enough local energy to cover your needs, we will act as a back-up, so that you will always have the power you need. The price of each service will be the same as your current tariff. You need to go to our website, log in to your account, and check a box indicating which service you would like to choose. You can switch at any time. Which service would you choose in this scenario? The single-provider service or the combined-provider service.
occupancy: spend a mix of time out and home
time: in a hurry, so rely more on fast, intuitive judgement

Customers of the combined-provider service will get most of their electricity from locally produced, renewable sources, such as solar and wind farms. If there is not enough local energy to cover your needs, we will act as a back-up, so that you will always have the power you need. The price of each service will be the same as your current tariff. You need to go to our website, log in to your account, and check a box indicating which service you would like to choose. You can switch at any time. Which service would you choose in this scenario? The single-provider service or the combined-provider service.
occupancy: spend a mix of time out and home
time: at your leisure, so rely more on calculated, rational thought

explanation: As a homeowner with a low environmental concern, I am not particularly motivated by the idea of locally produced renewable energy. Given my personality traits and demographics, I feel more comfortable sticking with what I know and understand, rather than trying something new.
condition: Imagine that you receive the following letter from your current electricity supplier. Dear customer, We are working in partnership with LocalEnergy, a new local electricity company. You have automatically been switched to our new combined-provider service, which is offered in partnership with LocalEnergy. Customers of the combined-provider service will get most of their electricity from locally produced, renewable sources, such as solar and wind farms. If there is not enough local energy to cover your needs, we will act as a back-up, so that you will always have the power you need. Alternatively, you can switch back to our single-provider service. This means that all your energy will continue to be provided by us. The price of each service will be the same as your current tariff. If you would like to stay with the combined-provider service, you do not need to do anything. If you would rather change back to the single-provider service, you need to go to our website, log in to your account, and check a box indicating that you would like to switch. It will take a few days to switch. You can switch back at any time. What would you choose to do in this scenario? Stay with the combined-provider service, or switch back to the single-provider service.
occupancy: are at home most of time
time: at your leisure, so rely more on calculated, rational thought

condition: Imagine that you receive the following letter from your current electricity supplier. Dear customer, We are working in partnership with LocalEnergy, a new local electricity company. You have automatically been switched to our new combined-provider service, which is offered in partnership with LocalEnergy. Customers of the combined-provider service will get most of their electricity from locally produced, renewable sources, such as solar and wind farms. If there is not enough local energy to cover your needs, we will act as a back-up, so that you will always have the power you need. Alternatively, you can switch back to our single-provider service. This means that all your energy will continue to be provided by us. The price of each service will be the same as your current tariff. If you would like to stay with the combined-provider service, you do not need to do anything. If you would rather change back to the single-provider service, you need to go to our website, log in to your account, and check a box indicating that you would like to switch. It will take a few days to switch. You can switch back at any time. What would you choose to do in this scenario? Stay with the combined-provider service, or switch back to the single-provider service.

condition: Imagine that you receive the following letter from your current electricity supplier. Dear customer, We are working in partnership with LocalEnergy, a new local energy company. You are currently enrolled on our single-provider service. This means that all your electricity will continue to be provided by us. Alternatively, you can switch to the new combined-provider service, which is offered in partnership with LocalEnergy. Customers of the combined-provider service will get most of their electricity from locally produced, renewable sources, such as solar and wind farms. If there is not enough local energy to cover your needs, we will act as a back-up, so that you will always have the power you need. The price of each service will be the same as your current tariff. If you would like to stay with the single-provider service, you do not need to do anything. If you would rather change to the combined-provider service, you need to go to our website, log in to your account, and check a box indicating that you would like to switch. It will take a few days to switch. You can switch back at any time. What would you choose to do in this scenario? Stay with the single-provider service, or switch to the combined-provider service.

Alternatively, you can switch to the new combined-provider service, which is offered in partnership with LocalEnergy. Customers of the combined-provider service will get most of their electricity from locally produced, renewable sources, such as solar and wind farms. If there is not enough local energy to cover your needs, we will act as a back-up, so that you will always have the power you need. The price of each service will be the same as your current tariff. If you would like to stay with the single-provider service, you do not need to do anything. If you would rather change to the combined-provider service, you need to go to our website, log in to your account, and check a box indicating that you would like to switch. It will take a few days to switch. You can switch back at any time. What would you choose to do in this scenario? Stay with the single-provider service, or switch to the combined-provider service.
occupancy: are at home most of time
time: in a hurry, so rely more on fast, intuitive judgement

Customers of the combined-provider service will get most of their electricity from locally produced, renewable sources, such as solar and wind farms. If there is not enough local energy to cover your needs, we will act as a back-up, so that you will always have the power you need. Alternatively, you can switch back to our single-provider service. This means that all your energy will continue to be provided by us. The price of each service will be the same as your current tariff. If you would like to stay with the combined-provider service, you do not need to do anything. If you would rather change back to the single-provider service, you need to go to our website, log in to your account, and check a box indicating that you would like to switch. It will take a few days to switch. You can switch back at any time. What would you choose to do in this scenario? Stay with the combined-provider service, or switch back to the single-provider service.
occupancy: are at home most of time
time: in a hurry, so rely more on fast, intuitive judgement

explanation: As someone with medium environmental concern, left of centre politics, and high openness to new experience, I am inclined to switch to the combined-provider service to support renewable energy and innovation.

Customers of the combined-provider service will get most of their electricity from locally produced, renewable sources, such as solar and wind farms. If there is not enough local energy to cover your needs, we will act as a back-up, so that you will always have the power you need. The price of each service will be the same as your current tariff. You need to go to our website, log in to your account, and check a box indicating which service you would like to choose. You can switch at any time. Which service would you choose in this scenario? The single-provider service or the combined-provider service.
occupancy: spend a mix of time out and home
time: at your leisure, so rely more on calculated, rational thought

condition: Imagine that you receive the following letter from your current electricity supplier. Dear customer, We are working in partnership with LocalEnergy, a new local energy company. You now have the choice of two services: 1) Single-provider: This means that all your electricity will be provided by us. 2) Combined-provider: This service is offered in partnership with LocalEnergy. Customers of the combined-provider service will get most of their electricity from locally produced, renewable sources, such as solar and wind farms. If there is not enough local energy to cover your needs, we will act as a back-up, so that you will always have the power you need. The price of each service will be the same as your current tariff. You need to go to our website, log in to your account, and check a box indicating which service you would like to choose. You can switch at any time. Which service would you choose in this scenario? The single-provider service or the combined-provider service.
occupancy: are at home most of time
time: at your leisure, so rely more on calculated, rational thought

Customers of the combined-provider service will get most of their electricity from locally produced, renewable sources, such as solar and wind farms. If there is not enough local energy to cover your needs, we will act as a back-up, so that you will always have the power you need. Alternatively, you can switch back to our single-provider service. This means that all your energy will continue to be provided by us. The price of each service will be the same as your current tariff. If you would like to stay with the combined-provider service, you do not need to do anything. If you would rather change back to the single-provider service, you need to go to our website, log in to your account, and check a box indicating that you would like to switch. It will take a few days to switch. You can switch back at any time. What would you choose to do in this scenario? Stay with the combined-provider service, or switch back to the single-provider service.
occupancy: are at home most of time
time: at your leisure, so rely more on calculated, rational thought

explanation: I am risk-averse and value security and reliability, so I would choose to stay with the combined-provider service that guarantees a back-up from the current supplier if local energy isn't sufficient.

condition: Imagine that you receive the following letter from your current electricity supplier. Dear customer, We are working in partnership with LocalEnergy, a new local electricity company. You have automatically been switched to our new combined-provider service, which is offered in partnership with LocalEnergy. Customers of the combined-provider service will get most of their electricity from locally produced, renewable sources, such as solar and wind farms. If there is not enough local energy to cover your needs, we will act as a back-up, so that you will always have the power you need. Alternatively, you can switch back to our single-provider service. This means that all your energy will continue to be provided by us. The price of each service will be the same as your current tariff. If you would like to stay with the combined-provider service, you do not need to do anything. If you would rather change back to the single-provider service, you need to go to our website, log in to your account, and check a box indicating that you would like to switch. It will take a few days to switch. You can switch back at any time. What would you choose to do in this scenario? Stay with the combined-provider service, or switch back to the single-provider service.
